creator: vgendler@socal.rr.com
text:
Java classes in the WEB-INF/classes directory or in JAR in the WEB-INF/lib 
directory without package (default package) could not be instantiated.

However it works if a package is defined for all classes.

As a test case you can take Tag Libraries Tutorial:
http://java.sun.com/products/jsp/tutorial/TagLibrariesTOC.html
and deploy the template application:
http://java.sun.com/products/jsp/tutorial/TagLibraries17.html#62595


Run: http://localhost:8080/template/example/home

Here are error messages:
==============================================
org.apache.jasper.JasperException: Unable to compile class for JSPE:\jakarta-tom
cat-4.0-b5\bin\..\work\localhost\template\main_jsp.java:64: Class org.apache.jsp
.DefinitionTag not found.
                DefinitionTag _jspx_th_tlt_definition_0 = new DefinitionTag();

creator: craig.mcclanahan@sun.com
text:
This issue has been reported to the author of the template.  It is not legal to 
use a class that is not in a package, unless you import it explicitly.
